oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Trench art letter opener
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Trench art letter opener made from a .30-06 cartridge. The .30-06 was the stanadard ammunition of the American Springfield and the Enfield rifles used by US troops in France. On one side it is marked "Dijon" and the other has the soldiers name, A. L. Sisco engraved. Intiially, bored soldiers in the trenches would pick up spent shell casings or other metal items and turn them into pieces of art.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
